page.content: {4:}DECAYING TIMBER from fallen trees is an important link in the food chain, providing a home for many insects upon which birds like TREE-CREEPERS,NUTHATCHES and WOODPECKERS feed. In this damp and shady area FERNS thrive. {5:}WOODLAND MANAGEMENT BOARD {6:}This VIEWPOINT faces southward across the valley of the{R.Frome,}with {Lower Bockhampton}on the right, and{ {Weymouth}beyond the distant ridge of hills. {7:}Looking eastwards the VIEW across the farmland is towards the Forestry Commision's plantation of Puddletown Forest. In Autumn the nearby stumps are sometimes used as tables by SQUIRRELS and WOODMICE feeding on HAZELNUTS.
